sentences.text: On 27 January 2023, a Palestinians|Palestinian gunman killed at least seven civilians in the Israeli settlement of Neve Yaakov, in East Jerusalem, the Israeli occupied territories|occupied West Bank. The suspect is also reported as having shot at worshippers exiting a synagogue, and, according to the Israel Police|police, was shot and killed after he opened fire on the attending officers. It was Israel's deadliest peacetime Palestinian political violence|Palestinian attack since the 2008 Jerusalem yeshiva attack|Jerusalem yeshiva attack in 2008.

sentences.text: Palestinian militant groups did not claim the suspect as a member, but called the attack a natural retaliation for the January 2023 Jenin incursion|raid in Jenin the day prior that killed 10 Palestinians, while the Palestinian National Authority|Palestinian Authority blamed the Israeli government for "dangerous escalation".

sentences.text: Many nations and international organizations issued statements condemning the attack while others called for restraint.

references.text: <ref name=":32" /> Palestinian and Israeli sources stated that between 42 and 50 people had been arrested since the attack, mostly family members of the perpetrator.<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web |date=28 January 2023 |title=Since the attack in Jerusalem last night, Israeli occupation forces have detained some 50 Palestinians |url=https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/133057 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230128182032/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/133057 |archive-date=28 January 2023 |access-date=28 January 2023 |website=WAFA Agency}}</ref>

sentences.text: According to Haaretz, the attacker first walked 200 metres past the Neve Yaakov synagogue and killed four passersby and a motorcyclist. People who had heard the shots began to emerge from the synagogue and the attacker fired at them and then, on the way back to his car, killed two more people at an intersection (road)|intersection.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last1=Peleg |first1=Bar |last2=Breiner |first2=Josh |last3=Hasson |first3=Nir |date=28 January 2023 |title=Six Minutes of Terror: How the Deadliest Attack in Israel in Recent Years Unfolded |newspaper=Haaretz |url=https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-01-28/ty-article-magazine/.premium/six-minutes-of-terror-how-the-deadliest-attack-in-israel-in-recent-years-unfolded/00000185-f976-d4a2-adb5-f97e40e00000 |url-status=live |access-date=29 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131151/https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-01-28/ty-article-magazine/.premium/six-minutes-of-terror-how-the-deadliest-attack-in-israel-in-recent-years-unfolded/00000185-f976-d4a2-adb5-f97e40e00000 |archive-date=2 February 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: Seven people were killed in the attack, five men and two women. The victims ranged from ages 14 to 68. At least three other people were wounded.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Fabian |first=Emanuel |date=28 January 2023 |title=The 7 victims of Jerusalem terror shooting named; include teen and synagogue sexton |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/additional-victims-of-jerusalem-terror-shooting-idd-as-14-year-old-boy-father-of-3/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131152/https://www.timesofisrael.com/additional-victims-of-jerusalem-terror-shooting-idd-as-14-year-old-boy-father-of-3/ |archive-date=2 February 2023 |access-date=2 February 2023 |website=The Times of Israel |language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> One of the women killed was confirmed by Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy to have been a Ukrainian citizen.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Peleschuk |first=Dan |date=28 January 2023 |title=Zelenskiy says Ukrainian woman killed in Jerusalem attacks |language=en |work=Reuters |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/zelenskiy-says-ukrainian-woman-killed-jerusalem-attacks-2023-01-28/ |url-status=live |url-access=registration |access-date=28 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131154/https://www.reuters.com/world/zelenskiy-says-ukrainian-woman-killed-jerusalem-attacks-2023-01-28/ |archive-date=2 February 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: The shooting took place on International Holocaust Remembrance Day, which some commentators suggested could be connected to the attack. On the other hand, there is just as much to suggest that it was an act of revenge driven by biographical motives.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |last=Meier |first=Christian |place=Tel Aviv |title=Tote in Israel: Zwei Angriffe kurz nacheinander in Ostjerusalem |trans-title=Deaths in Israel: Two attacks in East Jerusalem in quick succession |language=de |url=https://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/ausland/zwei-angriffe-kurz-nacheinander-in-ostjerusalem-18637003.html |work=Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung |date=2023-01-28 |access-date=2023-02-10 |quote=Manche Kommentatoren wiesen darauf hin, dass die Tat am Internationalen Holocaust-Gedenktag stattfand. Sie zielte offensichtlich auf gläubige Juden ab. Allerdings spricht ebenso einiges dafür, dass die Attacke ein Racheakt war, der durch persönliche Umstände veranlasst worden ist. |trans-quote=Some commentators pointed out that the act took place on International Holocaust Remembrance Day. It was obviously aimed at religious Jews. However, there is also strong evidence that the attack was an act of revenge triggered by personal circumstances. |archive-date=2 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131156/https://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/ausland/zwei-angriffe-kurz-nacheinander-in-ostjerusalem-18637003.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Neve Yaakov, the location where the attack took place, is an Israeli settlement in East Jerusalem established in 1972 on land expropriated from three neighboring Palestinian towns; it forms part of a Ring Settlements, East Jerusalem|belt of settlements interspersed among the area's Palestinian neighborhoods. Writing in Mondoweiss, Jalal Abukhater argues that Neve Yaakov "in its entirety is built on private and titled lands, whose Palestinian owners were never consulted or compensated before the hostile takeover", in addition to being home of the Israeli Defence Force's Central Command (Israel)|Central Command over the West Bank, and the "attack cannot be separated from this context."

references.text: <ref name=Mondo>{{cite news |url=https://mondoweiss.net/2023/02/contextualizing-the-shooting-in-neve-yaakov/ |title=Contextualizing the shooting in Neve Yaakov |work=Mondoweiss |first=Jalal |last=Abukhater |date=2 February 2023 |access-date=6 February 2023 |archive-date=6 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230206013923/https://mondoweiss.net/2023/02/contextualizing-the-shooting-in-neve-yaakov/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: The attacker was identified as Khairi Alqam, a 21-year-old resident of East Jerusalem. An eighteen-year-old relative of his had been killed two days before the attack by Israeli authorities after he reportedly threatened them with a gun which turned out to be a toy.

sentences.text: Alqam's grandfather, whom he was named after, was killed in the 1997–99 Jerusalem stabbings alongside three other Palestinians in 1998.

references.text: <ref name=faz /><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/israel-palestinian-shooter-named-after-grandfather-killed-settler |title=Palestinian shooter was named after grandfather killed by Israeli settler |work=Middle East Eye |date=28 January 2023 |access-date=28 January 2023 |archive-date=2 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131200/https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/israel-palestinian-shooter-named-after-grandfather-killed-settler |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Musa Alqam, the father of the attacker, said he had no knowledge of his son having planned for such an attack or if he was motivated by revenge.

God will help me and make him better tomorrow."<ref>{{cite web |date=28 January 2023 |title=אב המחבל שרצח 7 יהודים בירושלים: "שמח שהוא עשה זאת, זה כמו חתונה" |url=https://www.now14.co.il/%d7%90%d7%91-%d7%94%d7%9e%d7%97%d7%91%d7%9c-%d7%a9%d7%a8%d7%a6%d7%97-7-%d7%99%d7%94%d7%95%d7%93%d7%99%d7%9d-%d7%91%d7%99%d7%a8%d7%95%d7%a9%d7%9c%d7%99%d7%9d-%d7%a9%d7%9e%d7%97-%d7%a9%d7%94%d7%95/ |access-date=29 January 2023 |website=Now 14 |language=he |archive-date=2 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131715/https://www.now14.co.il/%D7%90%D7%91-%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%97%D7%91%D7%9C-%D7%A9%D7%A8%D7%A6%D7%97-7-%D7%99%D7%94%D7%95%D7%93%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%91%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%95%D7%A9%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%A9%D7%9E%D7%97-%D7%A9%D7%94%D7%95/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

at the scene]]
Palestinian and Israeli sources stated that between 42 and 50 people have been arrested since the attack, mostly members of the family of the perpetrator.

references.text: <ref name="autogenerated1"/><ref name="Rubin 2023"/> Additionally, Israel is planning on Israeli demolition of Palestinian property#Punitive demolition|demolishing the perpetrator's house. On 28 January, his home was evacuated and sealed in preparation for demolition.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-01-29/ty-article/.premium/israel-seals-off-home-of-jerusalem-synagogue-shooter-in-preparation-for-demolition/00000185-fc3f-def6-a7b5-fd3f65600000 |title=Israel Seals Off Home of Jerusalem Synagogue Shooter in Preparation for Demolition |newspaper=Haaretz|first1=Josh|last1=Breiner|first2=Jonathan|last2=Lis|date=29 January 2023 |access-date=29 January 2023 |archive-date=2 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131150/https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-01-29/ty-article/.premium/israel-seals-off-home-of-jerusalem-synagogue-shooter-in-preparation-for-demolition/00000185-fc3f-def6-a7b5-fd3f65600000 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Following the attack, the office of Benjamin Netanyahu, Prime Minister of Israel, reported that the Cabinet was pushing to strip the residency and citizenship rights of the families of the perpetrator of this attack and others, and also possibly forcibly deport them from the country to the occupied West Bank. The office also said social security benefits would be cancelled for the families of attackers.<ref name=Jaz29Jan/>

references.text: <ref name="PBS">{{Cite web |date=2023-01-29 |title=Israel prepares to demolish home of Palestinian gunman |url=https://apnews.com/article/crime-benjamin-netanyahu-antony-blinken-west-bank-jerusalem-77ed3d0d4932996f7ee0ac5e427d9f23 |access-date=2024-12-16 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Human rights groups pointed out that such measures are collective punishment.

references.text: <ref name=PBS/> The Palestinian Foreign Ministry called the measures a "grave violations of international law, the Geneva Conventions, a collective punishment, and an extension of the Israeli policies aimed at affecting the Palestinian presence in Jerusalem."<ref>{{cite news |last1=al-Rujoub |first1=Awad |last2=Asmar |first2=Ahmed |date=30 January 2023 |title=Palestine condemns Israeli punitive measures after Jerusalem attack |website=Anadolu Agency |url=https://www.aa.com.tr/en/middle-east/palestine-condemns-israeli-punitive-measures-after-jerusalem-attack/2801112 |url-status=live |access-date=30 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230130111011/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/middle-east/palestine-condemns-israeli-punitive-measures-after-jerusalem-attack/2801112 |archive-date=30 January 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: Netanyahu himself pledged a "strong, swift and precise" response, and also announced plans to make it easier for Israelis to obtain firearms.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last=Lubell |first=Maayan |date=29 January 2023 |title=Israel promises swift response to synagogue shooting |language=en |work=Reuters |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-army-reinforces-west-bank-after-synagogue-shooting-2023-01-28/ |access-date=29 January 2023 |archive-date=29 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230129125125/https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-army-reinforces-west-bank-after-synagogue-shooting-2023-01-28/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="Jaz29Jan">{{Cite web |title=Netanyahu announces plans to arm Israelis after Jerusalem attack |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/29/netanyahu-announces-plans-to-arm-israelis-after-jerusalem-attack |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230130120235/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/29/netanyahu-announces-plans-to-arm-israelis-after-jerusalem-attack |archive-date=30 January 2023 |access-date=30 January 2023 |website=Al Jazeera}}</ref>

sentences.text:
and the West Bank by some Palestinians in celebration of the attack.]]
Mahmoud Abbas, President of the Palestinian National Authority, published a statement saying that "the government of Israel is fully responsible for this dangerous escalation."

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last=Khoury |first=Jack |date=January 28, 2023 |title=Israel at Fault for Escalation in Security Situation, Palestinian President Abbas Says |language=en |work=Haaretz |url=https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-01-28/ty-article/.premium/israel-at-fault-for-escalation-in-security-situation-palestinian-president-abbas-says/00000185-f8cc-def6-a7b5-fdcef67c0000 |url-status=live |access-date=28 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131709/https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-01-28/ty-article/.premium/israel-at-fault-for-escalation-in-security-situation-palestinian-president-abbas-says/00000185-f8cc-def6-a7b5-fdcef67c0000 |archive-date=2 February 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: Palestinian militant groups called the attack a retaliation for the Jenin raid. Hamas spokesman Hazem Qassem referred to the attack as "jihadist and resistance action in the city of Jerusalem" and stated that the battle against the occupation "continues and continues". PIJ spokesman Tariq Ezz El-Din praised what he referred to as a "suicide operation" in response to the "January 2023 Jenin incursion|Jenin massacre" the day prior.<ref name=":02" />

references.text: <ref name=":02">{{cite web |last= |title=Israel: 7 murdered in east Jerusalem terror attack, assailant 'neutralized' |url=https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/defense/1674844419-israel-shooting-attack-in-jerusalem-leaves-6-dead-assailant-neutralized |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131709/https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/defense/1674844419-israel-shooting-attack-in-jerusalem-leaves-6-dead-assailant-neutralized |archive-date=2 February 2023 |access-date=27 January 2023 |website=I24news |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Dozens of Palestinians congregated in impromptu gatherings across the Gaza Strip to celebrate the attack. Similar celebrations, including fireworks, sweets, gunfire and car honking, were reported in the West Bank cities of Ramallah, Nablus, Jenin, Hebron, and the East Jerusalem locality of Beit Hanina.

references.text: <ref name="apnews kills" /><ref>{{cite web |last= |title=Palestinian towns celebrate murder of 7 Israelis in Jerusalem synagogue attack |url=https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/middle-east/palestinian-territories/1674895909-palestinian-towns-celebrate-murder-of-7-israelis-in-jerusalem-synagogue-attack |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131709/https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/middle-east/palestinian-territories/1674895909-palestinian-towns-celebrate-murder-of-7-israelis-in-jerusalem-synagogue-attack |archive-date=2 February 2023 |access-date=28 January 2023 |website=I24news |language=en}}</ref>

<ref name="cnn7" /><ref>{{cite web |last1= |first1= |last2= |title=Palestinians celebrate deadly terror shooting in Jerusalem with fireworks, sweets |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/palestinians-celebrate-jerusalem-synagogue-massacre-with-fireworks-sweets/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230128220211/https://www.timesofisrael.com/palestinians-celebrate-jerusalem-synagogue-massacre-with-fireworks-sweets/ |archive-date=28 January 2023 |access-date=28 January 2023 |website=Times of Israel |language=en-US}}</ref>

sentences.text: Many nations and international organizations issued statements of condemnation following the shooting attack. According to two UN diplomats, it was also unanimously condemned by the 15 members of the United Nations Security Council|UN Security Council in a closed session.

references.text: <ref name=":32">{{cite web |last1=Fabian |first1=Emanuel |date=28 January 2023 |title=Palestinian Authority: Israel 'fully responsible' for 'dangerous escalation' |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/palestinian-authority-israel-fully-responsible-for-dangerous-escalation/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230128202443/https://www.timesofisrael.com/palestinian-authority-israel-fully-responsible-for-dangerous-escalation/ |archive-date=28 January 2023 |access-date=28 January 2023 |work=The Times of Israel |language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |last=Magid |first=Jacob |title=Jerusalem attack unanimously condemned at UN Security Council session on conflict |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/jerusalem-attack-unanimously-condemned-at-un-security-council-session-on-conflict/ |access-date=28 January 2023 |work=The Times of Israel|date=28 January 2023 |language=en-US |archive-date=2 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131710/https://www.timesofisrael.com/jerusalem-attack-unanimously-condemned-at-un-security-council-session-on-conflict/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text:
*{{flagu|France}} – The French government issued a statement that "France condemns in the strongest terms the appalling terrorist attack that targeted a synagogue in Jerusalem, killing at least seven people and injuring many more [...] This attack against civilians, at the time of prayer, and on the day of the international commemoration of the victims of the Holocaust is particularly despicable. France stands alongside the victims of this attack, as well as their families. In a context of growing tensions, we call on all parties to avoid actions that could fuel the spiral of violence".
*{{flagu|Germany}} – Olaf Scholz, Chancellor of Germany|German Chancellor said "There have been deaths and people wounded in the heart of Israel", and added he was "deeply shocked" by the "terrible" attacks. "My thoughts are with the victims and their families. Germany stands by the side of Israel".
*{{flagu|Jordan}} – Jordanian Foreign Ministry condemned the deadly shooting attack, and called on the parties to "stop all unilateral steps and provocations that encourage an escalation."
*{{flagu|Saudi Arabia}} – In an unusual move, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Saudi Arabia)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs warned that "the situation between Palestinians and Israelis will slide into further serious escalation," and added that "the Kingdom condemns all targeting of civilians."
*{{flagu|Turkey}} – Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Turkey)|Turkey's Ministry of Foreign Affairs release a statement saying: “We strongly condemn the terror attack at a synagogue in Jerusalem where many people lost their lives. We offer our condolences to the families of the victims, the Israeli government and people. We wish a speedy recovery to the wounded".

references.text: <ref name=":22">{{cite web |last= |date=28 January 2023 |title=World leaders condemn 'heinous' Jerusalem synagogue massacre |url=https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/international/1674885058-world-leaders-condemn-jerusalem-synagogue-massacre |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131710/https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/international/1674885058-world-leaders-condemn-jerusalem-synagogue-massacre |archive-date=2 February 2023 |access-date=28 January 2023 |website=I24news |language=en}}</ref>

<ref name=":32" />
*{{flagu|India}} – Arindam Bagchi, Official Spokesperson of the Ministry of External Affairs, stated: "We strongly condemn last night's terror attack in Jerusalem. We extend heartfelt condolences to the families of those who lost their lives and wish the injured a speedy recovery".<ref>{{Cite news |last= |first= |date=28 January 2023 |title=India condemns attack at Jerusalem synagogue |language=en-IN |work=The Hindu |url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/india-strongly-condemns-terror-attack-in-israels-jerusalem/article66443283.ece |url-status=live |url-access=subscription |access-date=29 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131712/https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/india-strongly-condemns-terror-attack-in-israels-jerusalem/article66443283.ece |archive-date=2 February 2023 |issn=0971-751X}}</ref>

<ref name=":2">{{Cite news |title=Saudi Arabia 'Condemns All Targeting of Civilians' After Deadly East Jerusalem Synagogue Attack |language=en |work=Haaretz|first1=Jack|last1=Khoury|first2=Ben|last2=Samuels |url=https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-01-28/ty-article/.premium/jordan-condemns-deadly-east-jerusalem-synagogue-attack/00000185-f774-d4a2-adb5-f77c51c80000 |access-date=29 January 2023|date=28 January 2023 |archive-date=2 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131711/https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-01-28/ty-article/.premium/jordan-condemns-deadly-east-jerusalem-synagogue-attack/00000185-f774-d4a2-adb5-f77c51c80000 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name=":2" /><ref>{{cite web |title=Riyadh condemns terror attack against Israelis in unusual move |url=https://www.anews.com.tr/middle-east/2023/01/28/riyadh-condemns-terror-attack-against-israelis-in-unusual-move |access-date=29 January 2023 |website=anews |language=en |archive-date=2 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131712/https://www.anews.com.tr/middle-east/2023/01/28/riyadh-condemns-terror-attack-against-israelis-in-unusual-move |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name=":22" />
*{{flagu|United Arab Emirates}} – UAE Foreign Affairs Ministry issued a statement expressing "its strong condemnation of the criminal act and its permanent rejection of all forms of violence and terrorism aimed at undermining security and stability in contravention of human values and principles."<ref name=":22" />
*{{flagu|United Kingdom}} – James Cleverly, UK Foreign Secretary (United Kingdom)|Foreign Secretary said: “To attack worshippers at a synagogue on Holocaust Memorial Day, and during Shabbat, is horrific. We stand with our Israeli friends.”<ref name=":3" /> UK ambassador in Israel Neil Wigan wrote: “I am appalled by reports of the terrible attack in Neve Yaakov tonight. Attacking worshippers at a synagogue on Erev Shabat is a particularly horrific act of terrorism. The UK stands with Israel".<ref name="cnn7"/>
*{{flagu|United States}} – Antony Blinken, United States Secretary of State|US Secretary of State said: "Our thoughts are with the Israeli people following the terrorist attack in Jerusalem. It is particularly tragic on International Holocaust Remembrance Day. We condemn this attack and express our condolences to the victims' families. May their memory be a blessing".<ref name=":22" />
*The attack was also condemned and condolences were extended by foreign ministers from Poland, Sweden, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, North Macedonia, Slovenia, the Czech Republic, Italy, and Japan.<ref name=":3">{{cite web |first1=Alexander |last1=Fulbright |first2=Jacob|last2=Magid |title=Washington, UN, UAE, many others condemn 'heinous, tragic' Jerusalem terror shooting |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/us-condemns-horrific-jerusalem-shooting-lapid-says-attack-heartbreaking/|date=27 January 2023 |access-date=28 January 2023 |work=The Times of Israel |language=en-US |archive-date=2 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202131712/https://www.timesofisrael.com/us-condemns-horrific-jerusalem-shooting-lapid-says-attack-heartbreaking/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
